name: Mercure Carcassonne Porte de la Cite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We chose to stay at the Hotel Mecure due to the great reviews this Hotel recieved on TripAdvisor. We were not dissapointed.
reviews.title: Marvellous Mecure

likes.liked: — clean, with efficient friendly staff, velue for money restaurant. felt safe
likes.disliked: — lack of tea, coffee making facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff were friendly and efficient, speaking excellent English.
reviews.title: Mercure, Carcassonne ... very good hotel

likes.disliked: — The bed.....way too soft for me

reviews.title: Dreamlike experience
reviews.text: Arriving very early at the Hotel via the airport shuttle (5 euros each) the reception staff tried to book us into our room, unfortunately it was not ready (We arrived hours before check-in) they stored our luggage in a back room for safety, giving us a ticket to retrieve it later, and handed us a map of the local area to explore.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a five minute walk from the Cite, where we later had a leisurely lunch and some good local wine.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

likes.liked: — loved the restaurant and open fire in the bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Returning to the Hotel, we were given room number 12, which had balcony doors opening onto a wonderful garden. The room was equiped with safe (get key from reception) wide screen TV, minibar. But no tea making facilities, so take your own if this is important to you. The room was cool, and the bed comfortable.
reviews.title: Newly renovated - Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — Window had to be either wide open or shut!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked this hotel a lot thanks to its brilliant location next to the cité and our free upgrade to a superior room. The superior room afforded us an excellent night's sleep. We were less happy with breakfast at €14 per person and the chaotic arrangements where there are too many people fighting for too few places.
reviews.title: Great sport - Some reservartions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Good location near city walls.Service in the bar for pre-dinner drinks was poor we had to ask for the table to be cleared of dirty glasses. Food in restaurant was quite good,service a little chaotic,to many untrained staff.
reviews.title: 1 night stay June 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pleasant clean hotel in excellent quiet location a couple of minutes walk from the old city walls. Common areas attractive, lovely pool but unheated and far too cold to swim in at the beginning of June which was a disappointment. Bedroom small but comfy bed, view over fields and very good bathroom. Staff variable - some very friendly and helpful - others not so much. Food mostly pretty good especially breakfast, but my husband suffered from a bad stomach after a dinner in the hotel - can only assume it was this as we had eaten and drunk exactly the same apart from that.
reviews.title: 4 night stay - June 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed short 3 night break starting 1st June 2013 in this pleasant hotel in a great location just outside the medieval city walls. Speedy check in by courteous and friendly receptionist. Second floor room was comfortable with a nice clean bathroom and great shower, tea and coffee making facilities and complimentary bottled water. Room looked out over open fields and was very quiet. Enjoyed evening meals on Saturday and Sunday in the hotel, These were really high quality, reasonably priced and enjoyed in a relaxed atmosphere. Would recommend the set menu and also the steak meal for 2 persons, cooked just as we liked it! Also had buffet breakfast, which was plentiful and always fresh. We did not use the pool/terrace area as it was very windy for the first few days, but this looked very nice and think it would be lovely in the warm sunshine, overlooked by the city walls and surrounded by gardens. The medieval city is about 5 mins stroll from the hotel, so easy to return for a quick break. All members of staff were very courteous and helpful. Would have no problem recommending this hotel, and hope to return to Carcassonne in the future.
reviews.title: 3 night stay - June 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrive at the Airport in Carcassonne, we used the dedicated airport transfer bus, which is just outside arrivals. It was 5Euros each and drops off at 4 places, the last being the medieval city. It took about 20+ mins and stopped only a short walk from the hotel. However, we decided to have a taxi back to the airport on departure, as this seemed more practical and took 12 mins - it cost 17Euros for 2 persons plus luggage.
reviews.title: Top-notch location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a bit further from the Cite entrance than we expected, especially troublesome because I had hurt my knee and had problems walking. Our room was small, but well appointed.
reviews.title: A surprisingly good dinner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because I wasn't anxious to walk back to the Cite for dinner, we thought we’d have to settle for a mediocre meal at the hotel but, much to our surprise, we had a really excellent dinner. Enormous delicious salads, which were made up of multiple ingredients that we had chosen, including shrimp and duck breast. Rack of lamb, two small chops, but perfectly done. Good dessert.
reviews.title: Location superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed here 2 nights, eat dinner here, do not bother going into town, dining was excellent! Rooms spacious clean, comfortable and quiet. 5 mins walk from the old city. Had a wonderful stay here!
reviews.title: Good hotel, nice food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for 2 nights for wife and I.
reviews.title: Great Location, Small Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never having been to carcasonne, I wasnt sure what to expect. But i was not dissapointed! The cité itself was absolutely stunning, and only literally a 2-3 minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was typically large chain hotel. Efficient, english speaking reception staff politely checkd us in (depsite the fact that we were there 3 hours BEFORE checkin !). Allocated a room on the 1st floor, which KINDA had a view of the Cité...Well, the top of a turret anyway !
reviews.title: Not as nice as we thought it would be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with most European chain hotels, the rooms WAS small, but did have a Flatscreen TV with a range of channels (only one english though, BBC World) and a fridge (useful for keeping water in!) which was actually the minibar..
reviews.title: Spoilt by the Cell-Size Standard Bedrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was clean and tidy with shower over a bath and wc and bidet. A little "tired" and probably could do with redecoration.
reviews.title: Some advice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Although we had mixed up the actual reservation, upon arrival they found us another room for that night and we were able to move back to Mercure the following day. Pricey food but convenience may be worth it. The walk to the old, walled city is short and this hotel definitely has a European charm about it.
reviews.title: Location and charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on the strength of previous reviews from Tripadvisor members and were not disappointed. The location just outside the main gate to the Citadel is superb and, in our opinion, even better than staying inside the walls as you have the wonderful exterior views day and night (beautifully lit) and the pleasure of leaving the world behind as you cross the drawbridge. The Pont Vieux and Ville Basse are a comfortable, picturesque walk away of about 15 minutes (public transport also available - Ligne 2).
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is quiet, well maintained and the staff are pleasant and very helpful. The rooms are not large but are roomy enough and the bathrooms are generous with bath, over shower, bidet and WC. Our large casement window overlooked the leafy gardens. Drivers will appreciate good access and parking.
reviews.title: A welcoming little hotel in a perfect location for visitors to 'La Cite'!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast is 12 euros but for those who don't want to eat much in the mornings the bar has an excellent coffee, baguette, jam and butter for 4.50. Even better is the superb 'salon de the' just inside the main gate on the right - they do a great 'petit dejeuner complet' for 6.50 - or have a tea or coffee and choose your own goodies from their mouthwatering selection of pastries.
reviews.title: Perfect location - good choice in Carcassonne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Would definitely recommend this good value Hotel in Carcassonne (pleasant pool, too, if you are visiting in the Summer months).
reviews.title: Loved the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel in june food very good the salad is a bed of leaves with a choice of 5 other items from 26 to add you c could easy make it a main coarse.
reviews.title: First time in France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A daily three course set menu including the salad as the starter for 18:50 euros very reasonable for a four star hotel.
reviews.title: Very Good. Excellent Restaurant and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very comprehensive breakfast with plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Great Sleep Over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative thing was finding someone to serve you at the bar in the evening.
reviews.title: Great location for the old city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely gardened area and close to the citadel.
reviews.title: Great, great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mercure has a great location just opposite the entrance to the beautiful walled city of Carcassonne. Our room was quite small but comfortable, bathroom very nice and clean. We did not use any other facility as we dined out on the city and had the hotel's coffee and tea in the room for breakfast, very nice feature to have a kettle in the room. is not standard in France! The swimming pool was still closed as we travelled early in May and it was still too cold. It did not look too inviting, but surely will be if it's 30 degrees outside! The hotel's position is a bit strange, tucked in between the modern city and the large parking lot for the city, but so close to the city that it's worthwhile to stay there. Free and safe parking in front or in the back of the hotel are useful.
reviews.title: Functional hotel in a very good location with free parking!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here overnight as the hotel is only a couple of minutes walk from the fabulous "La Cite" which we wanted to explore.
reviews.title: Tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at a number of Mercure hotels recently we felt the decor was a bit tired probably due to the high number of coach trips that frequent the hotel.
reviews.title: Mercure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and a good size with a comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin-Didn't disappoint.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were always busy and the restaurant full even at breakfast.
reviews.title: Perfect location for La Cite

aka: Mercure Carcassonne Porte De La Cite Hotel
description: 5 minutes walk from the medieval quarter and 10 minutes from the Canal du Midi and the lower city, you will find the Mercure Carcassonne tucked away in a leafy corner. The hotel features a restaurant, a garden, a bar with a fireplace, 56 rooms (including6 smoking rooms) and 3 meeting rooms. Free private secure car park. Whether for a business trip, a holiday or a conference, our hotel is a wonderful place to stay. Swimming pool closed for the 2008 season.
